title: honzakulich
author: honzakulich
content: Hi, finding btc payment gateway without kyc verification.I used cryptonator but yet is not working anymore.Can u advice my good btc payment gateway?

comments.author: DaveF
comments.body: Unless you host it yourself not having to go through KYC is going to be difficult.Your location matters too. Not all services are available everywhere. But if you are using a gateway to convert BTC to fiat most places are going to need / want to know who they are dealing with.If you are just accepting BTC and keeping it as BTC there are more options.-Dave

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: You might want to take a look at this thread for a list of options: What crypto payment gate is the best? survey of criteria, and pack of TOP. Please take note that it's not indicated there whether the service requires KYC or not. The payment commission percentage and the number of supported cryptocurrencies are the only additional data provided. User Husires has also made a [.List] Bitcoin Payment Processors. The list is divided into self-hosted and hosted. The list also includes information whether Lightning Network is supported or not, whether there's KYC or not, and others. I hope these couple of threads would help you.

comments.body: just be careful.although the 'exchange' platform or payment gateway may not manage a KYC system.if you want to become a gate way accepting btc and then handing businesses fiat.. or be a bitcoin 'merchant' offering btc to people for fiat..or an exchange swaping fiat for btc and btc for fiat....without KYC but where your fiat bank account is not associated with a business account where you registered as a money payment service. expect your bank to flag you doing business trading on a personal account if you are handling lots of random amounts of fiat around or receiving lots of random amounts of fiat on a personal account

comments.author: ABCbits
comments.body: Self-hosted such as BTCPay would be most ideal option. But if you're looking for easier option where you don't mind some privacy trade-off, consider Coinbase Commerce and Mycelium Gear. You just need to give your master public key and use their API.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: honzakulich on July 20, 2022, 12:52:59 AMCan u advice my good btc payment gateway?I would suggest checking out two open source Bitcoin payment processors, BTCPayServer and alternative lighter version called CypherpunkPay.Both of them are self-hosted, they have zero fees, they are not using any third-party, and you can set up Lightning payments, but CypherpunkPay is easier to set up and you can even run it on cheap VPS server.Cryptonator is centralized custodial service and I would not suggest using something like this.

comments.author: orekom
comments.body: Quote from: honzakulich on July 20, 2022, 12:52:59 AMHi, finding btc payment gateway without kyc verification.You don't necessarily have to use a server-based solution. Some offer frontend integration options. Just google "permissionless non-custodial crypto payment gateway".Atlos.io is a good option. It accepts multiple coins, including bitcoin, without KYC. And, it doesn't require running your own server software.

comments.author: Macadonian
comments.body: If you successfully find a way of accepting payments without kyc you might run into legal problems if your government require asking for information on your customers. I think this is some thing you should think about if you want to go this route and it might be worth asking a legal advisor on what you can and cannot do.

comments.author: BenCodie
comments.body: The better question you should be asking is "how do I create my own payment gateway". You'll instead receive resources that will allow you to create a payment gateway with a full node and some lite code. There is heaps of open-source code that will enable you to achieve this, such as some great solutions have already been posted above. Your own solution using your own node means that:You do not have to worry about anything like KYC or account limitationsNo fees or charges on your transactions (except network fees)You are in control of your data.You can resolve any issues that arise with payments yourself by exploring your node, instead of having to be in touch with a third party to look into it for you.Don't trust a company when you don't need to!

comments.author: hZti
comments.body: You may be violating a lot of laws if you dont do KYC, so be careful with that and look what are the rules for your location. Best possibility was always to find people that are willing to buy/sell bitcoins in person. You may be able to find those kind of people at your local bitcoin meet ups and it is also wise to do the transfer in a public place.
